title: Has God forgiven you for everything? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. But of course it’s god’s fault for making everything a sin, thus warranting the need to sacrifice his son to forgive us of our sins, instead of doing the easier task of making a lot less actions to be sinful. But in the end, god doesn’t care about what good deeds or sins you have committed (Isaiah 64:6). The only sin god won’t forgive you for is the sin of not believing in him (Matthew 12:31). And since I don’t believe in him, it’s his fault for not convincing me of his existence. Sorry, but I need facts. And god lacks any and all facts.

No, there is no point on earth where God will ever forgive you. THIS IS WHAT WILL HAPPEN TO YOU. Revelation 20:12-15 King James Version 12 And I saw the dead, small and great, stand before God; and the books were opened: and another book was opened, which is the book of life: and the dead were judged out of those things which were written in the books, according to their works. 13 And the sea gave up the dead which were in it; and death and hell delivered up the dead which were in them: and they were judged every man according to their works. 14 And death and hell were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death. 15 And whosoever was not found written in the book of life was cast into the lake of fire.

God is ever forgiving and always loving. It is up to the person concerned to keep up the commitments they willingly make to God/themselves. A person who chooses the path of sinfulness, is bold enough to face the consequences arising out of such actions and preferred to keep God away. When a person includes God in all their actions, they normally refrain from committing sinful acts. Just because God forgives, it does not mean one does not suffer from sinfulness. By repentance, by sticking to righteousness, one can bravely withstand the testing times and come out joyfully. The beauty of this mortal life is one can willingly and consciously choose how they want to make the best of this life.

I believe so. I’ve done some awful things in the past (drug abuse, theft, driving under the influence, the list goes on), but my intent was never malicious. I want people to be happy. That’s all I want. If there is a higher power, I believe they’d forgive me for mistakes made. Now, if I had malicious intent, I’m not so sure. Just as important as God’s forgiveness, to me, I’ve forgiven myself. That’s a tough one.

More importantly, I have forgiven my self for most of my trespasses against people.. Not everything yet but all in good time, when I have done my sums. God needs to work on its own trespasses against sentient beings. I am happy to forgive God, but God needs to take responsibility and apologise. Once God has apologised, we can all move on.

Yes. I am a born again child of God, and He has forgiven me of all my sins, past, present, and future. No born again believer can ever be judged for sins, as Jesus has paid the price in my stead. So, should I just live for the day and sin willfully? No. Sin still has consequences in this life. We cannot use our freedom as a license to sin. Romans 6:1–2

Yup. Except I don’t think your god is the same as mine. See, I don’t have to ask for forgiveness. It is known that I make mistakes but the important thing is for me to learn as much as I can in this life and teach by example what I have already learned.

Ephesians 1:4–6 just as He chose us in Him before the foundation of the world, that we would be holy and blameless before Him. In love He predestined us to adoption as sons through Jesus Christ to Himself, according to the kind intention of His will, to the praise of the glory of His grace, which He freely bestowed on us in the Beloved. Since I am an adopted child of God, prior to the foundation of the world then, all of my sins had to be forgiven me (past, present and future).

I don't see why He would or should. There are some things that I still ain't sorry for and some trespasses I haven't forgiven yet. I'm concentrating on being grateful and appreciative of what I have. Deep thoughts on how I got here… eventually. Probably. My moments of regret are unlikely to be enough but.. God will forgive me, it's his job.

First tell me how can a man come to know that God has forgiven him? Is he (mentioned as ‘a man’) another god? No, he is not ‘another god’. He is just a man, who has no super power except will-power. But this will-power will also fail to know God's will. So my answer to your question is: God knows the best.
yes He has and it feels wonderful.
Yes He has. He is faithful to his promise to forgive me from my sin and cleanse me from all unrighteousness (1 John 1:9).
There is an old saying: “To know all is to forgive all.” as in people have reasons for whatever they do. If God knows all, then it would be evil of him to punish anyone for doing bad things.

God has forgiven me because he doesn't hold anything against us anyway our karma is written the minute we do something good or bad and it accordingly cones back in the same manner just because your karma comes back to you because of SOMETHING you have done in the past doesn't mean God has not FORGIVEN you and is holding stuff against you god is very loving

Absolutely yes, but I am still in this fleshy world and find times I must get on my knees and ask for guidance and some days forgiveness for falling short of complete righteousness that Jesus walked in. This is my hope.
There is nothing to forgive. Everything is happening exactly how it is supposed to. Anything that you do that harms another—-you do out of a lack of consciousness.

Yes I believe God has forgiven me my sins. I have asked forgiveness in the name and blood of JESUS and asked for the Holy Spirit to give me strength to resist the devil. The Bible says to do so I believe so. And it is so. Amen
there is no god to do any forgiving
If u are a born again child of God, Jesus Christ has taken your past, present, and future sins upon Him on the cross when He gave his life for u.
Yes God is the almighty and merciful.. If you understand your vices and ask for forgiveness from a pious heart.. God will forgive you for everything
Well I sure hope so because I have confessed so many sins for a number of years and I don’t think I can even remember all their names
Yes. Jesus said quite clearly, “Your sins have been forgiven", and he illustrated this quite colourfully in the parable of the prodigal son.
God forgave everyone for all things before we were ever created. Was sacrificing his son not enough of a sign that he only has love for us that is without condition and beyond measure?
